skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.

skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with standard frontend tooling scripts. No malicious code, dangerous patterns, or security vulnerabilities detected. Scripts follow safe practices with proper error handling and validation.

content.value_statement: Quickly scaffold, develop, and bundle sophisticated React-based HTML artifacts for claude.ai with pre-configured Tailwind CSS and 40+ shadcn/ui components.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + TypeScript + Vite projects with full shadcn/ui component library
Auto-configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn theme system and CSS variables
Bundle entire React apps into single self-contained HTML files
Support path aliases (@/) for clean imports
Include 40+ pre-installed shadcn/ui components (buttons, dialogs, forms, tables, etc.)
Auto-detect Node version and ensure compatibility (Node 18+)
Configure Parcel bundler with TypeScript path resolution
Inline all JavaScript, CSS, and dependencies into single artifact
limitations: Only for complex artifacts requiring React/state management/routing, not simple HTML/JSX
Requires Node.js 18 or higher and pnpm package manager
Bundling removes source maps for smaller file size
Project must have index.html in root directory for bundling
Not suitable for artifacts requiring server-side functionality

output_examples.output:
Creates a fully-configured React + TypeScript + Vite project with:
- 40+ shadcn/ui components installed
- Tailwind CSS configured with theme variables
- Path aliases (@/) set up
- All dependencies installed
- Ready to start development
bundle.html (245KB) - single self-contained HTML file with all JavaScript, CSS, and React components inlined, ready to share as claude.ai artifact

best_practices: Only use this skill for complex artifacts requiring React state, routing, or multiple shadcn components
Follow design guidelines: avoid centered layouts, purple gradients, uniform rounded corners, and Inter font to prevent 'AI slop' aesthetics
Test artifacts only when necessary or requested, not upfront (adds latency)
Use semantic component imports: import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
Leverage pre-installed shadcn components instead of building custom UI from scratch
Ensure index.html exists in project root before bundling
Share bundled artifact with user immediately after creation, test later if issues arise
anti_patterns: Using this skill for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts (use standard claude.ai artifacts instead)
Running without pnpm installed (script installs it, but pre-installation is faster)
Modifying .parcelrc after auto-generation (breaks path alias resolution)
Testing/visualizing artifact before sharing with user (adds unnecessary latency)
Overusing centered layouts and purple gradients (creates generic 'AI slop' appearance)
Bundling without an index.html entry point in project root

faq.question: What's the difference between this and standard claude.ai artifacts?
faq.answer: Standard artifacts are for simple single-file HTML/JSX. This skill is for complex artifacts requiring React state management, routing, multiple components, or the full shadcn/ui library.

faq.question: Which shadcn/ui components are included?
faq.answer: 40+ components: accordion, alert, avatar, badge, breadcrumb, button, calendar, card, carousel, checkbox, collapsible, command, context-menu, dialog, drawer, dropdown-menu, form, hover-card, input, label, menubar, navigation-menu, popover, progress, radio-group, resizable, scroll-area, select, separator, sheet, skeleton, slider, sonner, switch, table, tabs, textarea, toast, toggle, toggle-group, tooltip, and more.

faq.question: What Node version do I need?
faq.answer: Node.js 18 or higher. The init script auto-detects your version and pins Vite 5.4.11 for Node 18, or uses latest Vite for Node 20+.

faq.question: Can I use this for server-side functionality?
faq.answer: No, this creates client-side-only single HTML artifacts. For server functionality, use a different approach with actual backend deployment.

faq.question: How big are the bundled files?
faq.answer: Varies by complexity, typically 200-500KB for artifacts with multiple shadcn components. All dependencies are inlined for portability.

faq.question: Should I test the artifact before sharing?
faq.answer: Only if necessary or requested. Best practice is to share the artifact immediately, then test later if issues arise, to minimize latency.

dependencies: Vite (version pinned based on Node version)
permissions: File system write access (creates project directories and files)
